themes: Lack of inclusive and transparent planning process
Perceived political interference and predetermined outcomes
Instability and frequent changes in funding programs
Inequity between established institutions and emerging or marginalized groups
Barriers to accessing diverse funding sources
Need for differentiated support based on group history and capacity
key_phrases: actual planning process that includes ALL affected parties
sham attempts to justify and result that has been decided behind closed doors
stop re-imagining them every couple of years
unattainable requirements such as hard matches or funding pauses
small, endangered group that will never in our lifetimes get the 'conservative' funding
Treating both groups the same is on its face inequitable
less political interference and more actual support
barriers_identified: Lack of inclusive and open planning process
Decisions made behind closed doors without affected groups' participation
Unattainable funding requirements (e.g., hard matches, funding pauses)
Inaccessibility of certain funding sources for new, unknown, or culturally specific groups
Instability due to frequent changes in program design
Inequitable treatment of groups with different histories and capacities
solutions_proposed: Implement a planning process that includes all affected parties and is open and professionally developed
Engage in an acceptable, participatory process before making improvements
Reduce frequency of major program changes to support growth and sustainability
Tailor funding approaches to address the distinct needs of groups based on history, strength, cultural reach, and artistic competence
Reduce political interference in funding decisions
Provide dependable support for groups lacking business or political backing
